column4: hi, I'm trying to mount my usb stick via terminal.But when I mount it, I get a warning that says:   "/mnt/usb seems to be mounted read-only." And, I can't write anything to it. even with sudo
can anybody help me please?
what command do you use to mount it?
try with « udisks --mount /dev/sdb1 »
thanks for the suggestion. I tried with it. but I get a warning saying something like: couldn't connect to system bus!
is server version?
what do you mean?
if you are running the server version of ubuntu. or normal ( gnome ) one
normal xfce. sorry.
ahh ok. not sure if xubuntu supports udisks or not...
I see. can't I get it working with mount command?
what filesystem does the usb drive use?
sadly, ntfs!
sudo mount -t ntfs-3g -o uid=1000,umask=000 /dev/sdb1 /mnt/usb
now we are ticking. this doesn't know what ntfs-3g file system is!
not installed?
install  ntfs-3g
great. installing. hopefully it'll be OK. thanks.
are you sure you have full xubuntu-desktop ? i am surprised it does not include ntfs-3g
I played with the system a lot. so probably uninstalled it somewhere along the line! I'm new to this.
ok; do « sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop » ? to make sure everything is as it should be?
sure.
with the installation of ntfs-3g, it's now working correctly. thanks for the command and the pointers. just updating.
